item.title: Install Docker
item.description: What is Docker? In short: “An open source project to pack, ship and run any application as a lightweight container.” In practice Docker povide an isolated sharable environment (dev and ship) allow to change dev env without messing-up the host OS ease an app installation is based on lxc (linux containers) and Go remove the need of a virtual machines, it can be used in a similar way but it is different â†’ much more lightweight is (quite) secure (everything is sandboxed), though I don’t like its process run as root allow you to commit changes is based on images and containers: templates and running instances (that lose memory on shutdown I don’t want to write an essay on Docker, just present it briefly and describe the best (in my opinion) way to install it on *buntu.
